tags.name: bucket
tags.description: - The Bucket instance this file is     attached to.

tags.name: name
tags.description: - The name of the remote file.

tags.name: metadata
tags.description:
- Metadata to set on the object. This is useful     when you are creating a file for the first time, to prevent making an
    extra call to `setMetadata`.

description.full:
A File object is created from your Bucket object using
{module:storage/bucket#file}.
description.summary:
A File object is created from your Bucket object using
{module:storage/bucket#file}.

tags.description: If the destination file is not provided.

description.full:
Copy this file to another file. By default, this will copy the file to the
same bucket, but you can choose to copy it to another Bucket by providing
either a Bucket or File object.
description.summary:
Copy this file to another file. By default, this will copy the file to the
same bucket, but you can choose to copy it to another Bucket by providing
either a Bucket or File object.

description.full:
Create a readable stream to read the contents of the remote file. It can be
piped to a writable stream or listened to for 'data' events to read a file's
contents.
description.summary:
Create a readable stream to read the contents of the remote file. It can be
piped to a writable stream or listened to for 'data' events to read a file's
contents.

tags.name: metadata
tags.description: - Set the metadata for this file.

description.full:
Create a writable stream to overwrite the contents of the file in your
bucket.

A File object can also be used to create files for the first time.
description.summary:
Create a writable stream to overwrite the contents of the file in your
bucket.
description.body: A File object can also be used to create files for the first time.

tags.description: if an expiration timestamp from the past is given.

tags.name: options.contentMd5
tags.description:
- The MD5 digest value in base64. If you     provide this, the client must provide this HTTP header with this same
    value in its request.

tags.name: options.contentType
tags.description: - If you provide this value, the client     must provide this HTTP header set to the same value.

tags.name: options.expires
tags.description: - Timestamp (seconds since epoch) when this     link will expire.

tags.name: options.extensionHeaders
tags.description: - If these headers are used, the     server will check to make sure that the client provides matching values.

description.full:
Get a signed URL to allow limited time access to the file.

{@link https://developers.google.com/storage/docs/accesscontrol#Signed-URLs}
description.summary: Get a signed URL to allow limited time access to the file.

tags.name: metadata
tags.description: - The metadata you wish to set.

description.full:
Developer Documentation

Private Methods

These methods deal with creating and maintaining the lifecycle of a stream.
All File objects are Duplex streams, which will allow a reader to pipe data
to the remote endpoint. Likewise, you can pipe data from a remote endpoint to
a writer.

Duplexify is used to allow us to asynchronously set the readable and writable
portions of this stream. We can't accept data for buffering until we have
made an authorized connection. Once we have such a connection, we call
setReadable and/or setWritable on the File instance (which is also a
Duplexify instance), which then opens the pipe for more data to come in or go
out.
description.body:
Private Methods

These methods deal with creating and maintaining the lifecycle of a stream.
All File objects are Duplex streams, which will allow a reader to pipe data
to the remote endpoint. Likewise, you can pipe data from a remote endpoint to
a writer.

Duplexify is used to allow us to asynchronously set the readable and writable
portions of this stream. We can't accept data for buffering until we have
made an authorized connection. Once we have such a connection, we call
setReadable and/or setWritable on the File instance (which is also a
Duplexify instance), which then opens the pipe for more data to come in or go
out.

description.full: Get a remote stream to begin piping a readable stream to.
description.summary: Get a remote stream to begin piping a readable stream to.
